intro: Aster caricifolius, commonly known as the marsh aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with purple-blue petals and yellow centers, typically blooming in late summer to early fall. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Aster caricifolius plays an important role in supporting pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
